result.execSummary:
The defendant Ethan S McClain was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Marijuana - county ordinance. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine to be paid within 20 days.  Penalty of civil judgment for non-payment.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ethan S McClain

records.addlTxt:
09:42 AM Defendant Ethan S McClain in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  
Court advises of right to an attorney.   Defendant to seek counsel.

Prosecuting attorney moves to amend charge to Possession of Marijuana contrary to ordinance 13-102-(C)(13), Wisconsin Statutes/Waukesha County Ordinances. 
Court approves amendment. 
No contest plea entered.  
The Court Orders the Following:	
$210.80 to be paid within 20 days. Failure to pay; the Court orders civil judgment to be entered.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor
